vn.uiza.views.draggablepanel

Class DraggablePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • vn.uiza.views.draggablepanel.DraggablePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class DraggablePanel
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    Custom view created to handle DraggableView using fragments. With this custom view the client code can configure the top and bottom fragment and other elements like: top fragment height, top fragment margin right, top fragment x scale factor, top fragment y scale factor, top fragment margin bottom and enable or disable horizontal alpha effect.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeToLeft()
      Close the custom view applying an animation to close the view to the left side of the screen.
      void closeToRight()
      Close the custom view applying an animation to close the view to the right side of the screen.
      void initializeView()
      Apply all the custom view configuration and inflate the main widgets.
      boolean isClickToMaximizeEnabled()
      Return if user can maximize minimized view on click.
      boolean isClickToMinimizeEnabled()
      Return if user can minimize maximized view on click.
      boolean isClosedAtLeft()
      Checks if the top Fragment is closed at the left place.
      boolean isClosedAtRight()
      Checks if the top Fragment closed at the right place.
      boolean isMaximized()
      Checks if the top Fragment is maximized.
      boolean isMinimized()
      Checks if the top Fragment is minimized.
      void maximize()
      Maximize the custom view applying an animation to return the view to the initial position.
      void minimize()
      Minimize the custom view applying an animation to put the top fragment on the bottom right corner of the screen.
      void setBottomFragment(android.support.v4.app.Fragment bottomFragment)
      Configure the Fragment that will work as secondary element inside this custom view.
      void setBottomUZTimebar(int bottomUZTimebar) 
      void setClickToMaximizeEnabled(boolean enableClickToMaximize)
      Enable or disable click to maximize view when dragged view is minimized If your content have a touch/click listener (like YoutubePlayer), you need disable it to active this feature.
      void setClickToMinimizeEnabled(boolean enableClickToMinimize)
      Enable or disable click to minimize view when dragged view is maximized If your content have a touch/click listener (like YoutubePlayer), you need disable it to active this feature.
      void setDraggableListener(DraggableListener draggableListener)
      Configure the DraggableListener that is going to be invoked when the view be minimized, maximized, closed to the left or right.
      void setEnableHorizontalAlphaEffect(boolean enableHorizontalAlphaEffect)
      Configure the disabling of the alpha effect applied when the view is being dragged horizontally.
      void setEnableSlide(boolean isEnableSlide) 
      void setFragmentManager(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager)
      Configure the FragmentManager used to attach top and bottom fragment inside the view.
      void setTopFragment(android.support.v4.app.Fragment topFragment)
      Configure the Fragment that will work as draggable element inside this custom view.
      void setTopFragmentMarginBottom(int topFragmentMarginBottom)
      Configure the top Fragment margin bottom applied when the view has been minimized.
      void setTopFragmentMarginRight(int topFragmentMarginRight)
      Configure the top Fragment margin right applied when the view has been minimized.
      void setTopFragmentResize(boolean topViewResize)
      Configure the top Fragment to resize instead of scale it.
      void setTopViewHeight(int topFragmentHeight)
      Configure the height associated to the top Fragment used inside the view as draggable element.
      void setTopViewHeightApllyNow(int topFragmentHeight) 
      void setTouchEnabled(boolean touchEnable) 
      void setXScaleFactor(float xScaleFactor)
      Configure the horizontal scale factor applied when the top fragment is dragged to the bottom of the custom view.
      void setYScaleFactor(float yScaleFactor)
      Configure the vertical scale factor applied when the top fragment is dragged to the bottom of the custom view.
      void slideHorizontally(float slideOffset, float drawerPosition, int width)
      Slide the view based on scroll of the nav drawer.

      • setTopFragment

        public void setTopFragment(android.support.v4.app.Fragment topFragment)
        Configure the Fragment that will work as draggable element inside this custom view. This Fragment has to be configured before initialize the view.
        Parameters:
        topFragment - used as draggable element.

        topFragmentHeight - in pixels.

      • setTopViewHeightApllyNow

        public void setTopViewHeightApllyNow(int topFragmentHeight)

      • isClickToMaximizeEnabled

        public boolean isClickToMaximizeEnabled()
        Return if user can maximize minimized view on click.

      • setClickToMaximizeEnabled

        public void setClickToMaximizeEnabled(boolean enableClickToMaximize)
        Enable or disable click to maximize view when dragged view is minimized If your content have a touch/click listener (like YoutubePlayer), you need disable it to active this feature.
        Parameters:
        enableClickToMaximize - to enable or disable the click.

      • isClickToMinimizeEnabled

        public boolean isClickToMinimizeEnabled()
        Return if user can minimize maximized view on click.

      • setClickToMinimizeEnabled

        public void setClickToMinimizeEnabled(boolean enableClickToMinimize)
        Enable or disable click to minimize view when dragged view is maximized If your content have a touch/click listener (like YoutubePlayer), you need disable it to active this feature.
        Parameters:
        enableClickToMinimize - to enable or disable the click.

      • slideHorizontally

        public void slideHorizontally(float slideOffset,
                              float drawerPosition,
                              int width)
        Slide the view based on scroll of the nav drawer. "setEnableTouch" user prevents click to expand while the drawer is moving. It's only possible to maximize the view when @slideOffset is equals to 0.0, in other words, closed.
        Parameters:
        slideOffset - Value between 0 and 1, represent the value of slide: 0.0 is equal to close drawer and 1.0 equals open drawer.
        drawerPosition - Represent the position of nav drawer on X axis.
        width - Width of nav drawer

      • setXScaleFactor

        public void setXScaleFactor(float xScaleFactor)
        Configure the horizontal scale factor applied when the top fragment is dragged to the bottom of the custom view.

      • setYScaleFactor

        public void setYScaleFactor(float yScaleFactor)
        Configure the vertical scale factor applied when the top fragment is dragged to the bottom of the custom view.

      • setTopFragmentMarginRight

        public void setTopFragmentMarginRight(int topFragmentMarginRight)
        Configure the top Fragment margin right applied when the view has been minimized.
        Parameters:
        topFragmentMarginRight - in pixels.

      • setTopFragmentMarginBottom

        public void setTopFragmentMarginBottom(int topFragmentMarginBottom)
        Configure the top Fragment margin bottom applied when the view has been minimized.
        Parameters:
        topFragmentMarginBottom - in pixels.

      • setDraggableListener

        public void setDraggableListener(DraggableListener draggableListener)
        Configure the DraggableListener that is going to be invoked when the view be minimized, maximized, closed to the left or right.

      • setEnableHorizontalAlphaEffect

        public void setEnableHorizontalAlphaEffect(boolean enableHorizontalAlphaEffect)
        Configure the disabling of the alpha effect applied when the view is being dragged horizontally.
        Parameters:
        enableHorizontalAlphaEffect - to enable or disable the effect.

      • setTopFragmentResize

        public void setTopFragmentResize(boolean topViewResize)
        Configure the top Fragment to resize instead of scale it.

      • closeToLeft

        public void closeToLeft()
        Close the custom view applying an animation to close the view to the left side of the screen.

      • closeToRight

        public void closeToRight()
        Close the custom view applying an animation to close the view to the right side of the screen.

      • maximize

        public void maximize()
        Maximize the custom view applying an animation to return the view to the initial position.

      • minimize

        public void minimize()
        Minimize the custom view applying an animation to put the top fragment on the bottom right corner of the screen.

      • initializeView

        public void initializeView()
        Apply all the custom view configuration and inflate the main widgets. The view won't be visible if this method is not called.

        FragmentManager, top Fragment and bottom Fragment have to be configured before initialize this view. If not, this method will throw and IllegalStateException.

      • isMaximized

        public boolean isMaximized()
        Checks if the top Fragment is maximized.
        Returns:
        true if the view is maximized.

      • setBottomUZTimebar

        public void setBottomUZTimebar(int bottomUZTimebar)

      • isMinimized

        public boolean isMinimized()
        Checks if the top Fragment is minimized.
        Returns:
        true if the view is minimized.

      • isClosedAtRight

        public boolean isClosedAtRight()
        Checks if the top Fragment closed at the right place.
        Returns:
        true if the view is closed at right.

      • isClosedAtLeft

        public boolean isClosedAtLeft()
        Checks if the top Fragment is closed at the left place.
        Returns:
        true if the view is closed at left.

        public void setTouchEnabled(boolean touchEnable)
